body: @hohwille I agree, this could be better, are you keen to contribute this one ?
@joel-costigliola Can I contribute on this, given two weeks passed since you asked @hohwille ?

@joel-costigliola 
Is this message fine or do you maybe have other suggestions?

```
java.lang.AssertionError: [detailed extra hint I want to see if this fails] 
Actual:
  ["foo", "bar"]
is not empty while group of values to look for is

```

I reused a message that was already there in `org.assertj.core.internal.Arrays#failIfEmptySinceActualIsNotEmpty(java.lang.Object)`

I did not create a specific message for the `containsExactly` test case as `failIfEmptySinceActualIsNotEmpty` is used in several places.
Sorry for being M.I.A. and not responding a big thanks to @joel-costigliola for contribution and @joel-costigliola for review/taking care.

It looks like fixing the javadocs for all cases would require changing many files so I made a new issue just for this:
https://github.com/assertj/assertj/issues/3249

issue.title: Better error message instead of "actual is not empty while group of values to look for is" #3230

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
This changes the message for arrays and iterables as mentioned in #3230

#### Check List:
* Fixes #3230
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : NA
* PR meets the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

Following the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) will make it easier for us to review and accept your PR.
